de.sub.goobi.metadaten

Class RenderableMetadataGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.metadaten.RenderableMetadatum
      • de.sub.goobi.metadaten.RenderableMetadataGroup
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RenderablePersonMetadataGroup

    public class RenderableMetadataGroup
extends RenderableMetadatum
    Backing bean for a set of backing beans for input elements to edit a metadata group, with the ability to switch the type of metadata group under edit. It provides the currently selected type of metadata group to add, a list of all types to choose from and the members of the chosen type in order to browse and alter their values.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

      The function getMembers returns the input elements of this metadata group.

      Returs the currently showing metadata group as a MetadataGroup so that it can be added to some structural element.

    • Field Detail

      • members

        protected Map<String,de.sub.goobi.metadaten.RenderableGroupableMetadatum> members
        Holds backing beans for the metadata types that are part of the currently selected metadata type. The backing beans are held as values in this map with their respective metadata type names as keys.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderableMetadataGroup

        public RenderableMetadataGroup(Collection<ugh.dl.MetadataGroupType> addableTypes,
                               String projectName)
                        throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Creates a RenderableMetadataGroup instance able to add any metadata group that still can be added to the currently selected level of the document structure hierararchy.
        Parameters:
        addableTypes - all metadata group types available for adding to the current logical document structure node
        projectName - project that the act whose metadata group is to edit belongs to
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - if a single value metadata field is configured to show a multi-select input

      • RenderableMetadataGroup

        public RenderableMetadataGroup(ugh.dl.MetadataGroup data,
                               Metadaten container,
                               String language,
                               String projectName)
                        throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Creates a new RenderableMetadataGroup instance to display and modify a metadata group that has already been assigned to a logical document structure node. This constructor configures the backing beans for the input elements that represent the fields of the metadata group to automatically update the linked metadata group at the moment their setters are called and provides the ability to delete the associated metadata group from the document structure node. Changing the metadata group type is not possible.
        Parameters:
        data - metadata group whose data shall be shown
        container - metadata editor instance this RenderableMetadataGroup is showing in
        language - display language to use
        projectName - project that the process whose metadata group is to edit belongs to
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - if a single value metadata field is configured to show a multi-select input

      • RenderableMetadataGroup

        protected RenderableMetadataGroup(ugh.dl.MetadataType metadataType,
                                  ugh.dl.MetadataGroup binding,
                                  RenderableMetadataGroup container,
                                  ugh.dl.MetadataGroupType type,
                                  String projectName)
                           throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Protected constructor for classes extending RenderableMetadataGroup, creates a new RenderableMetadataGroup with exactly one type.
        Parameters:
        metadataType - metadata type this element is for
        binding - a metadata group whose value(s) shall be read and updated if as the getters and setters for the bean are called
        container - metedata group this element belongs to
        type - group type of the element to create
        projectName - name of the project the act belongs to
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - if a single value metadata field is configured to show a multi-select input

      • RenderableMetadataGroup

        public RenderableMetadataGroup(RenderableMetadataGroup master,
                               Collection<ugh.dl.MetadataGroupType> addableTypes)
        Copy constructor, creates a RenderableMetadataGroup initialised with the data from an existing metadata group, but still able to add any metadata group that still can be added to the currently selected level of the document structure hierarchy. Initialises the type to the type of the copy master and sets the values of the fields to the values of the copy master, but doesn’t bind them to the copy master, so changing the values late won’t arm the master object this copy is derived from.
        Parameters:
        master - a metadata group that a copy shall be created of
        addableTypes - all metadata group types that still can be added to the logical document hierarchy node currently under edit

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public void copy()
        Invokes the metadata editor to show the subpage to add a new metadata group, initialised with the values from this instance in order to create a copy of this instance. This method is provided for the reason that action methods on repeatable elements must be implemented as parameterless methods on the backing beans of the respective list items in JSF. This method just forwards the function call to the component owning the list, which is the more convenient way to implement add or remove operations on lists.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Invokes the metadata editor to delete the metadata group under edit in this instance from the logical document structure node currently under edit. This method is provided for the reason that action methods on repeatable elements must be implemented as parameterless methods on the backing beans of the respective list items in JSF. This method just forwards the function call to the component owning the list, which is the more convenient way to implement add or remove operations on lists.

      • getMembers

        public Collection<de.sub.goobi.metadaten.RenderableGroupableMetadatum> getMembers()
        The function getMembers returns the input elements of this metadata group.
        Returns:
        the input elements of this group

      • getRowspan

        public String getRowspan()
        Returns the number of elements in the members list, to be used for the label cell height in HTML.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the members list.

      • getPossibleTypes

        public Collection<javax.faces.model.SelectItem> getPossibleTypes()
        The function getPossibleTypes() returns the list of metadata group types available for the currently selected document structure element. Depending on the rule set, availability means that some elements cannot be added more than once and thus may not be available to add any more.
        Returns:
        the metadata group types available

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The function getSize() returns the number of elements in this metadata group.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in this group

      • getType

        public String getType()
        Returns the internal name of the metadata group type currently under edit to JSF so that it can mark the appropriate option as selected in the metadata group type select box. The user will be shown the label returned for the corresponding element in getPossibleTypes(), not the internal name.
        Returns:
        the internal name of the metadata group type

      • isCopyable

        public boolean isCopyable()
        Returns whether another instance of the metadata group type under edit in this instance can be created on the logical document structure node currently under edit in the metadata editor to either render the action link to copy this metadata group, or not.
        Returns:
        the internal name of the metadata group type

      • setType

        public void setType(String type)
             throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        The procedure setType() will be called by JSF to pass back in the metadata group type the user chose to edit, referenced by its name. If it differs from the current one, this renderable metadata group will be updated to represent the new type instead.
        Parameters:
        type - name of the metadata group type desired
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - if a metadata field designed for a single value is misconfigured to show a multi-value input element

      • toMetadataGroup

        public ugh.dl.MetadataGroup toMetadataGroup()
        Returs the currently showing metadata group as a MetadataGroup so that it can be added to some structural element.
        Returns:
        the showing metatdata group as ugh.dl.MetadataGroup
